TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable NoStartupFormException extends System.Exception

Docs.summary: This exception is thrown by the Visual Basic Application Model when the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.WindowsFormsApplicationBase.MainForm%2A> property has not been set.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Visual Basic Application Model requires that the application set the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.WindowsFormsApplicationBase.MainForm%2A> property before running the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.WindowsFormsApplicationBase.OnRun%2A> method. If the property is not set, the Visual Basic Application Model raises this exception. For more information, see [Extending the Visual Basic Application Model](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
> [!NOTE] > For information about how to set the startup form by using the **Project Designer**, see [Application Page, Project Designer (Visual Basic)](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Visual Basic Application Model requires that the application set the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.WindowsFormsApplicationBase.MainForm%2A> property before running the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.WindowsFormsApplicationBase.OnRun%2A> method. If the property is not set, the Visual Basic Application Model raises this exception. For more information, see [Extending the Visual Basic Application Model](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.NoStartupFormException>.
||| |-|-| |Property|Value| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|A null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The localized error-message string.|

MemberSignature.Value: .method public specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message) cil managed

Docs.param: A message that describes the error.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The content of the `message` parameter is intended to be understood by humans. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
<xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.ApplicationServices.NoStartupFormException> inherits from <xref:System.Exception>. This constructor sets the properties of the <xref:System.Exception> object as shown in the following table.
||| |-|-| |Property|Value| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|A null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic)| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The `message` string.|

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyspecialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo info, valuetype System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext context) cil managed

Docs.param: The object that holds the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
The <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext> object that contains contextual information about the source or destination.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with serialized data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor is called during deserialization to reconstitute the exception object transmitted over a stream.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message, class System.Exception inner) cil managed

Docs.param: The <xref:System.Exception> object that is the cause of the current exception. If the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> parameter is not a null reference ( in Visual Basic), the current exception is raised in a catch block that handles the inner exception.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The content of the `message` parameter is intended to be understood by humans. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property. The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor, or a null reference if the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.ApplicationException>.
||| |-|-| |Property|Value| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|The `inner` reference.| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The `message` string.|
